<script type="text/javascript">
var maindomain_lang = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var main_site_url = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var ajax_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';	
function getParameterByName(name, url) {
		if(url == null){
		  url = window.location.href;
		}
	    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
	    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
		results = regex.exec(url);
	    if (!results) return null;
	    if (!results[2]) return '';
	    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
	}
	var container_q = getParameterByName('container');
	var d_lang = 'en';	
</script>

	<title>Cardinal RAT Active for Over Two Years</title>

<meta property="og:author" content="Josh Grunzweig"/>

<meta name="post_tags" content="Cardinal RAT,Carp Downloader,excel,Trojan"/>
<script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"BlogPosting","headline":"Cardinal RAT Active for Over Two Years","name":"Cardinal RAT Active for Over Two Years","description":"Unit 42 researchers discover a previously unknown Trojan (RAT) that uses an innovative downloader embedded in malicious excel documents.","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/unit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years\/","mainEntityOfPage":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/unit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years\/","datePublished":"April 20, 2017","articleBody":"Palo Alto Networks has discovered a previously unknown remote access Trojan (RAT) that has been active for over two years. It has a very low volume in this two-year period, totaling roughly 27 total samples. The malware is delivered via an innovative and unique technique: a downloader we are calling Carp uses malicious macros in Microsoft Excel documents to compile embedded C# (C Sharp) Programming Language source code into an executable that in turn is run to deploy the Cardinal RAT malware family. These malicious Excel files use a number of different lures, providing evidence of what attackers are using to entice victims into executing them.\n\nThe malware from start to finish exhibits the following high level operations as shown in Figure 1:\n\nFigure 1 Malware execution flow\nCarp Downloader\nAs previously mentioned, we have observed Cardinal RAT being delivered using a unique technique involving malicious Excel macros. We are calling these delivery documents the Carp Downloader, as they make use of a specific technique of compiling and executing embedded C# (CshARP) language source code that acts as a simple downloader.\n\nWe observed the following example macro in the most recent sample. Note that we have prefixed the function names with \u2018xx_\u2019 to make it easier for the reader to understand what is going on. Additionally, we have added comments to explain what is happening, as well as the un-obfuscated strings that are found within the macro.\n\n\n\nFigure 2 Portion of malicious macro containing base64-encoded source code\n\n\n\nFigure 3 Portion of malicious macro responsible for compiling and executing embedded source code\n\nAs a quick recap of what the malicious macro is doing, it begins by generating two paths\u2014a path to a randomly named executable, and randomly named C# file in the %APPDATA%\\\\Microsoft folder. It then base64-decodes the embedded C# source code as shown in Figure 2 and writes it to the C# file path previously generated. Finally, as shown in Figure 3 it will compile and execute this C# source code using the Microsoft Windows built-in csc.exe utility.\n\nThe decoded source code in this example looks like the following as shown in Figure 4.\n\n\n\nFigure 4 Decoded source code\n\nAs we can see, it simply downloads a file from secure.dropinbox[.]pw using HTTP on port 443 (not HTTPS), and proceeds to decrypt the file using AES-128 prior to executing it. At this point, Cardinal RAT has been downloaded and executed, and execution is directed to this sample. Of course, the Carp Downloader is not required to download Cardinal RAT, however, based on our visibility, it has exclusively done so.\n\nA total of 11 unique Carp Downloader samples have been observed to date. The following figures show lures that we observed in these samples.\n\n\n\nFigure 5 Lure with a filename of Top10Binary_Sample_HotLeads_13.9.xls\n\n&nbsp;\n\n\n\nFigure 6 Lure with a filename of AC_Media_Leads_ReportGenerator_5.2.xls\n\n&nbsp;\n\n\n\nFigure 7 Lure with an unknown filename\n\n&nbsp;\n\n\n\nFigure 8 Lure with a filename of Arabic 22.12_Pre qualified.xls\n\n&nbsp;\n\n\n\nFigure 9 Lure with an unknown filename\n\n\n\n\n\nFigure 10 Lure with a filename of Hot_Leads_Export_09.03_EN.xls\n\nAs we can see from the above examples, the majority of these lures are financial-related, describing various fake customer lists for various organizations. Based on the similarities witnessed in some of these lures, it appears that the attackers use some sort of template, where they simply swap specific cells with the pertinent images or information.\nCardinal RAT\nThe name Cardinal RAT comes from internal names used by the author within the observed Microsoft .NET Framework executables. To date, 27 unique samples of Cardinal RAT have been observed, dating back to December 2015. It is likely that the low volume of samples seen in the wild is partly responsible for the fact that this malware family has remained under the radar for so long.\n\nAn unobfuscated copy of Cardinal RAT was identified, which allowed us to view the decompiled class and function names. A subset of these may be seen below in Figure 11. This allowed us to not only easily identify the full functionality of the RAT, but also made it easier to identify and reverse-engineer various aspects of the malware itself.\n\n\n\nFigure 11 Decompiled Cardinal RAT classes\n\nWhen initially executed, the malware will check its current working directory. Should it not match the expected path, Cardinal will enter its installation routine. Cardinal RAT will copy itself to a randomly named executable in the specified directory. It will then compile and execute embedded source code that contains watchdog functionality. Specifically, this newly spawned executable will ensure that the following registry key is set:\n\n \tHKCU\\\\Software\\\\Microsoft\\\\Windows NT\\\\CurrentVersion\\\\Windows\\\\Load\n\nThis specific key is set to point towards the path of the previously copied Cardinal RAT executable path. The executable will periodically query this registry key to ensure it is set appropriately. If the executable finds the registry key has been deleted, it will re-set it. The Load registry key acts as a persistence mechanism, ensuring that this Cardinal RAT executes every time a user logs on. More information about the Load registry key may be found here.\n\nThis watchdog process also ensures that the Cardinal RAT process is always running, as well as ensures that the executable is located in the correct path. Should either of these conditions not be met, the watchdog process will spawn a new instance of Cardinal RAT, or write Cardinal RAT to the correct location, respectively.\n\nAfter the installation routine, Cardinal RAT will inject itself into a newly spawned process. It will attempt to use one of the following installed executables for the newly spawned process:\n\n \tRegAsm.exe\n \tRegSvcs.exe\n \tvbc.exe\n \tcsc.exe\n \tAppLaunch.exe\n \tcvtres.exe\n\nCardinal RAT will continue to parse an embedded configuration. This configuration, named internally as \u2018GreyCardinalConfig\u2019, is a binary blob that contains a mixture of base64-encoded data, DWORDs, and Boolean values. Using a custom written Python script, we parsed the configuration of an example sample:\n$ python decode_parse_config.py GreyCardinalConfig\nMutex: cpS3H2NSA65T67mUqB3a\nGUID: 952407f889285547985aa2fcf35c5383\nCampaign: 04\/04\/2016 Public\nNumber of C2 Servers: 1\nC2 Server: secure[.]affiliatetoday[.]xyz\nPort: 4425\nCommunication Key: H7sVBirLvGwVfLSLSeI2\nConnection Delay: 3500\nBuffer Size: 20480\nMax Buffer Size: 40960000\nUnknown Integer: 70000\nPrevent System Sleeping: 0\nHide File: 0\nDie on Sandbox Detection: 0\nKeylogging: 1\nInstall Name: None\n\nAs we can see, this particular sample is configured with a single command and control (C2) server, however, we have seen other samples with multiple host and port combinations. We can also identify a communication key in it, which is crucial when discussing network communications.\n\nAfter the configuration is parsed, Cardinal RAT will proceed with making attempts at connecting with the C2. Using an example request and response from a C2 server, we can see how this traffic is configured.\n\n\n\nFigure 12 Parsed network traffic communication\n\nData is transmitted in two pieces\u2014a DWORD specifying the data length, as well as the data itself. The data is encrypted using a series of XOR and addition operations, followed by decompression using the ZLIB library. Represented in Python, this may be implemented as follows:\ndef decrypt(md5_key, data):\n  key = data[-1]\n  remaining = data[0:-1]\n  c = 0\n  out = \"\"\n  for x in remaining:\n    b = md5_key[c%len(md5_key)]\n    out += chr(ord(x) ^ ord(b) + ord(key) &amp; 255)\n    c+=1\n  if len(out) &gt; 15:\n    if ord(out[0]) == 1:\n      out = zlib.decompress(out[1:], -15)\n  return out\n\nThe \u2018md5_key\u2019 argument in the function above is the MD5 hash of the previously defined \u2018H7sVBirLvGwVfLSLSeI2\u2019 string that was contained within Cardinal RAT\u2019s embedded configuration. Now that we know how to decrypt the data, we can look at the previously shown PCAP data and determine what is being sent. The first message decrypts to the following:\n$ python decrypt_cardinal_pcap.py \nData Length: 3\n00000000: 00 00\nFollowed by the Cardinal RAT\u2019s response:\n$ python decrypt_cardinal_pcap.py \nData Length: 148\n00000000: 00 95 24 07 F8 89 28 55  47 98 5A A2 FC F3 5C 53  ..$...(UG.Z...\\S\n00000010: 83 4A 00 61 00 73 00 6F  00 6E 00 20 00 42 00 6F  .J.a.s.o.n. .B.o\n00000020: 00 72 00 6E 00 00 00 4A  00 41 00 53 00 4F 00 4E  .r.n...J.A.S.O.N\n00000030: 00 42 00 4F 00 52 00 4E  00 2D 00 50 00 43 00 00  .B.O.R.N.-.P.C..\n00000040: 00 30 00 34 00 2F 00 30  00 34 00 2F 00 32 00 30  .0.4.\/.0.4.\/.2.0\n00000050: 00 31 00 36 00 20 00 50  00 75 00 62 00 6C 00 69  .1.6. .P.u.b.l.i\n00000060: 00 63 00 00 00 57 00 69  00 6E 00 64 00 6F 00 77  .c...W.i.n.d.o.w\n00000070: 00 73 00 20 00 37 00 20  00 55 00 6C 00 74 00 69  .s. .7. .U.l.t.i\n00000080: 00 6D 00 61 00 74 00 65  00 20 00 00 00 00 00 00  .m.a.t.e. ......\n00000090: 00 00 31 00 2E 00 34 00  00 00 30 00 37 00 38 00  ..1...4...0.7.8.\n000000A0: 42 00 46 00 42 00 46 00  44 00 30 00 30 00 30 00  B.F.B.F.D.0.0.0.\n000000B0: 33 00 30 00 36 00 44 00  32 00 00 00              3.0.6.D.2...\n\nThis communication represents the C2 server asking the Cardinal RAT to retrieve and upload victim information (\u2018\\x00\\x00\u2019), to which the malware responds accordingly. As we can see in the above decrypted stream, the malware returns a wealth of information, including the following:\n\n \tUsername\n \tHostname\n \tCampaign Identifier\n \tMicrosoft Windows version\n \tVictim unique identifier\n \tProcesser architecture\n \tMalware version (1.4)\n\nThe malware itself is equipped with a number of features, including the following:\n\n \tCollect victim information\n \tUpdate settings\n \tAct as a reverse proxy\n \tExecute command\n \tUninstall itself\n \tRecover passwords\n \tDownload and Execute new files\n \tKeylogging\n \tCapture screenshots\n \tUpdate Cardinal RAT\n \tClean cookies from browsers\n\nConclusion\nCardinal RAT is deployed using an interesting technique of compiling and executing a downloader via a malicious macro embedded within a Microsoft Excel file. The Excel files themselves contain lures that have financial themes. This threat has had a low volume of samples in the past two years, with 11 instances of Carp Downloader and 27 instances of Cardinal RAT observed. Palo Alto Networks customers are protected by these threats in the following ways:\n\n \tAll samples discussed are classified as malicious by the WildFire sandbox platform\n \tAll identified domains have been classified as malicious\n \tAutoFocus users can track the malware described in this report using the CarpDownloader and CardinalRAT\n\nAppendix\nCarp Downloader SHA256 Hashes\n\na52ba498d304906d6c060e8c56ad7db50e1af0a781616c0aa35447c50c28bae9\n\n5025aa0fc6d4ac6daa2d9a6452263dcc20d6906149fc0995d458ed38e7e57b61\n\n1181f97071d8f96f9cdfb0f39b697204413cc0a715aa4935fe8964209289b331\n\n84e705341a48c8c6552a7d3dd97b7cd968d2a9bc281a70c287df70813f5dca52\n\nae1a6c4f917772100e3a5dc1fab7de4a277876a6e626da114baf8179b13b0031\n\ne49e61da52430011f1a22084a601cc08005865fe9a76abf503a4a9d2e11a5450\n\n192b204dbc702d3762c953544975b61db8347a7739c6d8884bb4594bd816bf91\n\n571b58ba655463705f45d2541f0fde049c83389a69552f98e41ece734a59f8d4\n\n10f53502922bf837900935892fb1da28fc712848471bf4afcdd08440d3bd037f\n\n8bea55d2e35a2281ed71a59f1feb4c1cf6af1c053a94781c033a94d8e4c853e5\n\n057965e8b6638f0264d89872e80366b23255f1a0a30fd4efb7884c71b4104235\n\n&nbsp;\n\nCardinal RAT SHA256 Hashes\n\ne017651dd9e9419a7f1714f8f2cdc3d8e75aebbe6d3cfbb2de3f042f39aec3bd\n\n778090182a10fde1b4c1571d1e853e123f6ab1682e17dabe2e83468b518c01df\n\n8fababb509ad8230e4d6fa1e6403602a97e60dc8ef517016f86195143cf50f4e\n\n1977cedcfb8726dea5e915b47e1479256674551bc0fe0b55ddd3fa3b15eb82b2\n\n16aab89d74c1eaaf1e94028c8ccceef442eb2cd5b052cba3562d2b1b1a3a4ba6\n\n9c47b2af8b8c5f3c25f237dcc375b41835904f7cd99221c7489fb3563c34c9ab\n\n211b7b7a4c4a07b9c65fae361570dbb94666e26f0cc0fa0b32df4b09fcee6de2\n\nfd61a5cd1a83f68b75d47c8b6041f8640e47510925caee8176d5d81afac29134\n\n84f822d9cf575aeea867e9b73f88ad4d9244293e52208644e12ff2cf13b6b537\n\n855cf3a6422b0bf680d505720fd07c396508f67518670b493dba902c3c2e5dfa\n\n4b4c6b36938c3de0623feb92c0e1cb399d2dc338d2095b8ba84e862ef6d11772\n\n5dd162ab66f0c819ee73868c26ecd82408422e2b6366805631eab95ae32516f3\n\n6e2991e02d3cf17d77173d50cdaa766661a89721c3cc4050fba98bea0dbdb1a9\n\n1e8ed6e8d0b6fc47d8176c874ed40fb09644c058042f34d987878fa644f493cc\n\n647e379517fed71682423b0192da453ec1d61a633c154fdd55bab762bcc404f3\n\nebd4f45cbb272bcc4954cf1bd0a5b8802a6e501688f2a1abdb6143ba616aea82\n\nedc49bf7ec508becb088d5082c78d360f1a7cad520f6de6d8b93759b67aac305\n\n7482f8c86b63ce53edcb62fc2ff2dd8e584e2164451ae0c6f2b1f4d6d0cb6d9c\n\n2fbd3d2362acd1c8f0963b48d01f94c7a07aeac52d23415d0498c8c9e23554db\n\n154e3a12404202fd25e29e754ff78703d4edd7da73cb4c283c9910fd526d47db\n\nfc5f7a21d953c394968647df6a37e1f61db04968ad1aca65ad8f261b363fa842\n\na1d5b7d69d85b1be31d9e1cb0686094cc7b1213079b2a66ace01be4bfe3fb7c3\n\n4b0203492a95257707a86992e84b5085ce9e11810a26920dbb085005081e32d3\n\na05805bcec72fb76b997c456e0fd6c4b219fdc51cad70d4a58c16b0b0e2d9ba1\n\n4e953ea82b0406a5b95e31554628ad6821b1d91e9ada0d26179977f227cf01ad\n\n6272ed2a9b69509ac16162158729762d30f9ca06146a1828ae17afedd5c243ef\n\n440504899b7af6f352cfaad6cdef1642c66927ecce0cf2f7e65d563a78be1b29\n\n&nbsp;\n\nDomains\n\nns1[.]squidmilk[.]com\n\nns2[.]squidmilk[.]com\n\nz[.]realnigger[.]xyz\n\nns1[.]tconvulsit[.]com\n\nns1[.]fresweepy[.]com\n\nns2[.]iexogyrarax[.]com\n\nns1[.]xraisermz[.]com\n\nsecure[.]affiliatetoday[.]xyz\n\nsecure[.]gayporndownload[.]xyz\n\nsecure[.]gameofthrone[.]club\n\nsecure[.]dropinbox[.]pw\n\nsecure[.]mailserver02[.]xyz\n\nwe[.]niggerporn[.]xyz\n\nz[.]noplacelikehome[.]xyz\n\nns1[.]stackreports[.]com\n\nns2[.]stackreports[.]com\n\nns[.]liveupdate1[.]com\n\nns[.]nortonsecurity[.]in\n\nwe[.]letsdosomefun[.]xyz\n\nwe[.]be-smart[.]xyz\n\nz[.]newblood[.]xyz\n\nns2[.]ibandagerk[.]com\n\nns1[.]rmacutecompw[.]com\n\nns1[.]pholothud[.]com\n\nns1[.]athermoforw[.]com\n\nns1[.]lclownerymor[.]com\n\nns2[.]xunderfeatuv[.]com\n\nns3[.]ssaddlegirv[.]com\n\nns1[.]qcytasicspc[.]com\n\nns[.]7ni7[.]com\n\n&nbsp;\n\n\n\nIgnite \u201917 Security Conference: Vancouver, BC June 12\u201315, 2017\n\nIgnite \u201917 Security Conference is a live, four-day conference designed for today\u2019s security professionals. Hear from innovators and experts, gain real-world skills through hands-on sessions and interactive workshops, and find out how breach prevention is changing the security industry. Visit the Ignite website for more information on tracks, workshops and marquee sessions.","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","@id":"#panworg"},"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2016\/09\/unit42-web-banner-650x300-300x300.jpg","width":300,"height":300},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","xPath":["\/html\/head\/title","\/html\/head\/meta[@name='description']\/@content"]},"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Josh Grunzweig"}]}</script><link rel='stylesheet' id='crayon-css' href='https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/crayon-syntax-highlighter/css/min/crayon.min.css?ver=_2.7.2_beta' media='all' />

<script>var $ = jQuery;</script>

    <script type="text/javascript">
    ;(function(win, doc, style, timeout) {
    var STYLE_ID = 'at-body-style';
    function getParent() {
    return doc.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
    }
    function addStyle(parent, id, def) {
        if (!parent) {
        return;
        }
        var style = doc.createElement('style');
        style.id = id;
        style.innerHTML = def;
        parent.appendChild(style);
    }
    function removeStyle(parent, id) {
        if (!parent) {
            return;
        }
        var style = doc.getElementById(id);
        if (!style) {
            return;
        }
        parent.removeChild(style);
    }
    addStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID, style);
    setTimeout(function() {
    removeStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID);
    }, timeout);
    }(window, document, "body {visibility:hidden !important}", 3000));
    </script>

            <script src="https://assets.adobedtm.com/9273d4aedcd2/0d76ae0322d7/launch-425c423d843b.min.js" async></script>
            <script type="text/javascript" src="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/includes/attribution.js"></script>


<script type="text/javascript">
var isIE11 = !!navigator.userAgent.match(/Trident.*rv\:11\./);
if(isIE11){
    var polyfill = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/scripts/polyfill.min.js';
    document.write('<script type="text/javascript" src="'+polyfill+'">\x3C/script>');
}
    /**
 * String.prototype.replaceAll() polyfill
 * https://gomakethings.com/how-to-replace-a-section-of-a-string-with-another-one-with-vanilla-js/
 * @author Chris Ferdinandi
 * @license MIT
 */
if (!String.prototype.replaceAll) {
	String.prototype.replaceAll = function(str, newStr){
		// If a regex pattern
		if (Object.prototype.toString.call(str).toLowerCase() === '[object regexp]') {
			return this.replace(str, newStr);
		}
		// If a string
		return this.replace(new RegExp(str, 'g'), newStr);
	};
}

    /*! lozad.js - v1.16.0 - 2020-09-06 */
!function(t,e){"object"==typeof exports&&"undefined"!=typeof module?module.exports=e():"function"==typeof define&&define.amd?define(e):t.lozad=e()}(this,function(){"use strict";
/**
   * Detect IE browser
   * @const {boolean}
   * @private
   */var g="undefined"!=typeof document&&document.documentMode,f={rootMargin:"0px",threshold:0,load:function(t){if("picture"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()){var e=t.querySelector("img"),r=!1;null===e&&(e=document.createElement("img"),r=!0),g&&t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")&&(e.src=t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")),t.getAttribute("data-alt")&&(e.alt=t.getAttribute("data-alt")),r&&t.append(e)}if("video"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()&&!t.getAttribute("data-src")&&t.children){for(var a=t.children,o=void 0,i=0;i<=a.length-1;i++)(o=a[i].getAttribute("data-src"))&&(a[i].src=o);t.load()}t.getAttribute("data-poster")&&(t.poster=t.getAttribute("data-poster")),t.getAttribute("data-src")&&(t.src=t.getAttribute("data-src")),t.getAttribute("data-srcset")&&t.setAttribute("srcset",t.getAttribute("data-srcset"));var n=",";if(t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")&&(n=t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")),t.getAttribute("data-background-image"))t.style.backgroundImage="url('"+t.getAttribute("data-background-image").split(n).join("'),url('")+"')";else if(t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set")){var d=t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set").split(n),u=d[0].substr(0,d[0].indexOf(" "))||d[0];// Substring before ... 1x
u=-1===u.indexOf("url(")?"url("+u+")":u,1===d.length?t.style.backgroundImage=u:t.setAttribute("style",(t.getAttribute("style")||"")+"background-image: "+u+"; background-image: -webkit-image-set("+d+"); background-image: image-set("+d+")")}t.getAttribute("data-toggle-class")&&t.classList.toggle(t.getAttribute("data-toggle-class"))},loaded:function(){}};function A(t){t.setAttribute("data-loaded",!0)}var m=function(t){return"true"===t.getAttribute("data-loaded")},v=function(t){var e=1<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[1]?arguments[1]:document;return t instanceof Element?[t]:t instanceof NodeList?t:e.querySelectorAll(t)};return function(){var r,a,o=0<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[0]?arguments[0]:".lozad",t=1<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[1]?arguments[1]:{},e=Object.assign({},f,t),i=e.root,n=e.rootMargin,d=e.threshold,u=e.load,g=e.loaded,s=void 0;"undefined"!=typeof window&&window.IntersectionObserver&&(s=new IntersectionObserver((r=u,a=g,function(t,e){t.forEach(function(t){(0<t.intersectionRatio||t.isIntersecting)&&(e.unobserve(t.target),m(t.target)||(r(t.target),A(t.target),a(t.target)))})}),{root:i,rootMargin:n,threshold:d}));for(var c,l=v(o,i),b=0;b<l.length;b++)(c=l[b]).getAttribute("data-placeholder-background")&&(c.style.background=c.getAttribute("data-placeholder-background"));return{observe:function(){for(var t=v(o,i),e=0;e<t.length;e++)m(t[e])||(s?s.observe(t[e]):(u(t[e]),A(t[e]),g(t[e])))},triggerLoad:function(t){m(t)||(u(t),A(t),g(t))},observer:s}}});

</script>

<!-- <script src="https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api.js"></script>  -->

<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->

    </head>
<body class="wp-singular post-template-default single single-post postid-26595 single-format-standard wp-theme-unit42-v6 no-sidebar">
<header class="haeder py-15 position-relative z-index-2" style="display: none;">
  <div class="container px-sm-30 px-35">
    <div class="row">
        <div class="first-logo col-sm-auto col-6 mb-sm-0 mb-40 text-sm-center order-1">
                        <a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/">
                <img src="/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/PANW_Parent.png" width="140px" alt="Logo" />
            </a>
        </div>
      <div class="col-sm-auto col-6 text-sm-center order-sm-2 order-4 second-logo-unit">
        <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/">
            <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/unit42-logo-white.svg" class="attachment-full size-full" alt="Unit42 Logo"  width="150" height="35"/>
        </a>
      </div>

      <div class="col-auto d-sm-none ml-auto mb-40 order-2">
        <button class="btn__search" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#search" aria-label="search"><i class="ui ui-1"></i></button>

<nav id="navigation" class="site-nav collapse d-sm-block pb-20 mt-sm-10"  style="display: none!important;">
  <div class="container px-sm-30">
    <ul id="menu-primary-navigation" class="main-menu d-sm-flex font-weight-medium"><li id="menu-item-97290" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-97290"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tools/">Tools</a></li>

<div class="panClean pan-template-home" id="main-nav-menu-cont" style="display:none;">
    <div class="cleanHeader mainNavigationComp baseComponent parbase">
        <div class="productNav2021Component dark default" id="PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC">
        </div>

<div class="cleanTopHtml htmlComp baseComponent parbase"><div class="base-component-spacer spacer-none  "></div>

<!--  Start: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	function getCookie(cname) {
	 	var name = cname + "=";
  		var decodedCookie = decodeURIComponent(document.cookie);
		var ca = decodedCookie.split(';');
  		for(var i = 0; i <ca.length; i++) {
    			var c = ca[i];
    			while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
     				 c = c.substring(1);
    			}
    			if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
    				 return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
    			}
  		}
  		return "";
	}

	var referer = "";//sessionStorage.container;
	var pcontainer = sessionStorage.getItem("container");
	var searchResultsPagePath = "";
	if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Prisma')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Prisma' ;
	}        
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Cortex')!=-1)){
            if( pcontainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                referer = 'CloudCortex' ;
            }
            else{
                referer = 'Cortex' ;
            }	    
	}
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Sase')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Sase' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Unit')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Unit' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Ngfw')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Ngfw' ;
	}
        var fromRef = document.referrer;
        var nContainer = getCookie("navContainer");
        if(nContainer){//If user is coming from main site, we need to reset the container		
		if(fromRef  && fromRef.indexOf("prismacloud.io")!=-1){
                        referer = 'Prisma' ;
                        sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                } else if(fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.com")!=-1 || fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.jp")!=-1 ){
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Prisma') != -1){
                            referer = 'Prisma' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                        }
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Cortex') != -1){
                            if( nContainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                                referer = 'CloudCortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","CloudCortex");
                            }
                            else{
                                referer = 'Cortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","Cortex");
                            }                            
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Sase') != -1){
                            referer = 'Sase' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Sase");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Unit') != -1){
                            referer = 'Unit' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Ngfw') != -1){
                            referer = 'Ngfw' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Ngfw");
                        }
			document.cookie = 'navContainer=; path=/; domain=.paloaltonetworks.com; expires=' + new Date(0).toUTCString();
		}
	}
if(referer != "Prisma" && referer != "CloudCortex" && referer != "Cortex" && referer != "Sase" && referer != "Unit" && referer != "Ngfw") {
    referer = 'Unit' ;
    sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
}
function callMainSitePrismaNavHTML(){
    
    var referrer_domain = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
    sessionStorage.setItem("domain",referrer_domain);
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderPrisma.prismaRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=prisma&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/prismasearch";
        }
    if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortexcloud&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexcloudsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderCortex.cortexRenderer.html';	
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortex&domain=en';	
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Sase'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderSase.saseRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=sase&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/sasesearch";
    }
    if(referer == 'Unit'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=unit42&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/content/pan/en_US/search/unit42search";
		    }
    if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        //var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/ngfw-cdss-nav-renderer.php';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=ngfw&domain=en'; 
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/ngfwcdsssearch";
    }
    httpGet(menu_url,'menu_html');
    document.getElementById('main-nav-menu-cont').removeAttribute("style");
}
function addStyle(styles) {            
    /* Create style document */
    var css = document.createElement('style');
    css.type = 'text/css';

    if (css.styleSheet) 
        css.styleSheet.cssText = styles;
    else 
        css.appendChild(document.createTextNode(styles));

    /* Append style to the tag name */
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(css);
}
function httpGet(theUrl,req_type) {
    if (window.XMLHttpRequest) { // code for IE7+, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari
        xmlhttp=new XMLHttpRequest();
    } else {// code for IE6, IE5
        xmlhttp=new ActiveXObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP");
    }
    xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function()
    {
        if (xmlhttp.readyState==4 && xmlhttp.status==200)
        {
            if(req_type == 'menu_html'){
            var nav_text = xmlhttp.responseText.replaceAll('https://static.cloud.coveo.com/searchui/v2.9159/js/CoveoJsSearch.Lazy.min.js', '');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll('src="/', 'src="'+maindomain_lang+'/');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll("'/content", "'"+maindomain_lang+"/content");
                        
            document.getElementById("PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC").innerHTML = nav_text.replaceAll('href="/', 'href="'+maindomain_lang+'/');

            var lozad_back = document.getElementsByClassName('lozad-background');
            Array.prototype.forEach.call(lozad_back, function(el) {
            // Do stuff here
            var el_back_img_path = el.getAttribute('data-background-image');
            var first_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'");
            var last_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'",first_pos+1);
            el_back_img_path = el_back_img_path.substring(first_pos+1,last_pos);
            el.setAttribute("data-background-image",main_site_url+el_back_img_path);
            });
            const observer_lozad = lozad('.lozad, .lozad-background'); // lazy loads elements with default selector as '.lozad'
            observer_lozad.observe();
            }
            if(req_type == 'head_inline_css'){
            addStyle(xmlhttp.responseText);
            }
        }
    }
    xmlhttp.open("GET", theUrl, true );
    xmlhttp.send();    
}    
    
if(referer == 'Prisma' || referer == 'CloudCortex' || referer == 'Cortex' || referer == 'Sase' || referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
    const article = document.querySelector('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC');
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        article.dataset.type = 'prisma';
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    else if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cloudcortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Sase'){
        article.dataset.type = 'sase';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Unit'){
        article.dataset.type = 'unit';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        article.dataset.type = 'ngfw';
    }
    //set class to default
    if(referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    callMainSitePrismaNavHTML();
}
</script>
<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->

				</li>
				<li role="menuitem">
					<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Funit42.paloaltonetworks.com%2Funit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years%2F&#038;title=Cardinal%20RAT%20Active%20for%20Over%20Two%20Years" target="_blank" role="link" title="Share in LinkedIn" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="unit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years:share:linkedin"> <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-linkedin-share.svg" alt="LinkedIn Icon"></a>
				</li>
				<li role="menuitem">
					<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https%3A%2F%2Funit42.paloaltonetworks.com%2Funit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years%2F&#038;text=Cardinal%20RAT%20Active%20for%20Over%20Two%20Years" target="_blank" role="link" title="Share in Twitter" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="unit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years:share:twitter"> <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-twitter-share.svg" alt="Twitter Icon"></a>
				</li>
				<li role="menuitem">
					<a href="//www.reddit.com/submit?url=https%3A%2F%2Funit42.paloaltonetworks.com%2Funit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years%2F" target="_blank" role="link" title="Share in Reddit" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="unit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years:share:reddit"> <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-reddit-share.svg" alt="Reddit Icon"></a>
				</li>
				<li role="menuitem">
					<a href="https://mastodon.social/share?text=Cardinal%20RAT%20Active%20for%20Over%20Two%20Years%20https%3A%2F%2Funit42.paloaltonetworks.com%2Funit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years%2F" target="_blank" role="link" title="Share in Mastodon" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="unit42-cardinal-rat-active-two-years:share:mastodon"> <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-mastodon-share.svg" alt="Mastodon Icon"></a>
				</li>
	  </ul>
    </div>                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </section> 
    <section class="section blog-contents"> 
      <div class="pa blog-editor">
        <div class="l-container">
          <div class="be__wrapper">
            <div class="be__contents">
              <div class="be__contents-wrapper">
                <p>Palo Alto Networks has discovered a previously unknown remote access Trojan (RAT) that has been active for over two years. It has a very low volume in this two-year period, totaling roughly 27 total samples. The malware is delivered via an innovative and unique technique: a downloader we are calling Carp uses malicious macros in Microsoft Excel documents to compile embedded <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_Sharp_(programming_language)">C# (C Sharp) Programming Language</a> source code into an executable that in turn is run to deploy the Cardinal RAT malware family. These malicious Excel files use a number of different lures, providing evidence of what attackers are using to entice victims into executing them.</p>
<p>The malware from start to finish exhibits the following high level operations as shown in Figure 1:<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26598 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow.png" alt="carp_cardinal_flow" width="6645" height="3041" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow.png 6645w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow-900x412.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow-300x137.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow-768x351.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow-1024x469.png 1024w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/carp_cardinal_flow-370x169.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 6645px) 100vw, 6645px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 1 Malware execution flow</em></p>
<h3>Carp Downloader</h3>
<p>As previously mentioned, we have observed Cardinal RAT being delivered using a unique technique involving malicious Excel macros. We are calling these delivery documents the Carp Downloader, as they make use of a specific technique of compiling and executing embedded C# (CshARP) language source code that acts as a simple downloader.</p>
<p>We observed the following example macro in the most recent sample. Note that we have prefixed the function names with ‘xx_’ to make it easier for the reader to understand what is going on. Additionally, we have added comments to explain what is happening, as well as the un-obfuscated strings that are found within the macro.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26622 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2.png" alt="cardinal_2" width="973" height="133" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2.png 973w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2-900x123.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2-300x41.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2-768x105.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_2-370x51.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 973px) 100vw, 973px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 2 Portion of malicious macro containing base64-encoded source code</em></p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26646 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3.png" alt="cardinal_3" width="975" height="500" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3.png 975w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3-900x462.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3-300x154.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3-768x394.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_3-370x190.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 975px) 100vw, 975px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 3 Portion of malicious macro responsible for compiling and executing embedded source code</em></p>
<p>As a quick recap of what the malicious macro is doing, it begins by generating two paths—a path to a randomly named executable, and randomly named C# file in the %APPDATA%\\Microsoft folder. It then base64-decodes the embedded C# source code as shown in Figure 2 and writes it to the C# file path previously generated. Finally, as shown in Figure 3 it will compile and execute this C# source code using the Microsoft Windows built-in <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/78f4aasd.aspx">csc.exe utility</a>.</p>
<p>The decoded source code in this example looks like the following as shown in Figure 4.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26670 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4.png" alt="cardinal_4" width="975" height="1265" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4.png 975w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4-900x1168.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4-231x300.png 231w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4-768x996.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4-789x1024.png 789w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_4-370x480.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 975px) 100vw, 975px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 4 Decoded source code</em></p>
<p>As we can see, it simply downloads a file from secure.dropinbox[.]pw using HTTP on port 443 (not HTTPS), and proceeds to decrypt the file using AES-128 prior to executing it. At this point, Cardinal RAT has been downloaded and executed, and execution is directed to this sample. Of course, the Carp Downloader is not required to download Cardinal RAT, however, based on our visibility, it has exclusively done so.</p>
<p>A total of 11 unique Carp Downloader samples have been observed to date. The following figures show lures that we observed in these samples.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26694 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5.png" alt="cardinal_5" width="972" height="778" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5.png 972w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5-900x720.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5-300x240.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5-768x615.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_5-370x296.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 972px) 100vw, 972px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 5 Lure with a filename of Top10Binary_Sample_HotLeads_13.9.xls</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26718 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6.png" alt="cardinal_6" width="973" height="822" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6.png 973w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6-900x760.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6-300x253.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6-768x649.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_6-370x313.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 973px) 100vw, 973px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 6 Lure with a filename of AC_Media_Leads_ReportGenerator_5.2.xls</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26742 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7.png" alt="cardinal_7" width="974" height="729" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7.png 974w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7-900x674.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7-300x225.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7-768x575.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_7-370x277.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 974px) 100vw, 974px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 7 Lure with an unknown filename</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26766 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8.png" alt="cardinal_8" width="973" height="988" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8.png 973w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8-900x914.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8-295x300.png 295w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8-768x780.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_8-370x376.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 973px) 100vw, 973px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 8 Lure with a filename of Arabic 22.12_Pre qualified.xls</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26790 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9.png" alt="cardinal_9" width="975" height="990" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9.png 975w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9-900x914.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9-295x300.png 295w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9-768x780.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_9-370x376.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 975px) 100vw, 975px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 9 Lure with an unknown filename</p>
<p></em></p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26814 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10.png" alt="cardinal_10" width="975" height="217" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10.png 975w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10-900x200.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10-300x67.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10-768x171.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_10-370x82.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 975px) 100vw, 975px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 10 Lure with a filename of Hot_Leads_Export_09.03_EN.xls</em></p>
<p>As we can see from the above examples, the majority of these lures are financial-related, describing various fake customer lists for various organizations. Based on the similarities witnessed in some of these lures, it appears that the attackers use some sort of template, where they simply swap specific cells with the pertinent images or information.</p>
<h3>Cardinal RAT</h3>
<p>The name Cardinal RAT comes from internal names used by the author within the observed Microsoft .NET Framework executables. To date, 27 unique samples of Cardinal RAT have been observed, dating back to December 2015. It is likely that the low volume of samples seen in the wild is partly responsible for the fact that this malware family has remained under the radar for so long.</p>
<p>An unobfuscated copy of Cardinal RAT was identified, which allowed us to view the decompiled class and function names. A subset of these may be seen below in Figure 11. This allowed us to not only easily identify the full functionality of the RAT, but also made it easier to identify and reverse-engineer various aspects of the malware itself.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_11.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26838 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_11.png" alt="cardinal_11" width="627" height="956" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_11.png 627w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_11-197x300.png 197w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Cardinal_11-370x564.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 627px) 100vw, 627px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 11 Decompiled Cardinal RAT classes</em></p>
<p>When initially executed, the malware will check its current working directory. Should it not match the expected path, Cardinal will enter its installation routine. Cardinal RAT will copy itself to a randomly named executable in the specified directory. It will then compile and execute embedded source code that contains watchdog functionality. Specifically, this newly spawned executable will ensure that the following registry key is set:</p>
<ul>
<li>HKCU\\Software\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Windows\\Load</li>
</ul>
<p>This specific key is set to point towards the path of the previously copied Cardinal RAT executable path. The executable will periodically query this registry key to ensure it is set appropriately. If the executable finds the registry key has been deleted, it will re-set it. The Load registry key acts as a persistence mechanism, ensuring that this Cardinal RAT executes every time a user logs on. More information about the Load registry key may be found <a href="https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee851671.aspx">here</a>.</p>
<p>This watchdog process also ensures that the Cardinal RAT process is always running, as well as ensures that the executable is located in the correct path. Should either of these conditions not be met, the watchdog process will spawn a new instance of Cardinal RAT, or write Cardinal RAT to the correct location, respectively.</p>
<p>After the installation routine, Cardinal RAT will inject itself into a newly spawned process. It will attempt to use one of the following installed executables for the newly spawned process:</p>
<ul>
<li>RegAsm.exe</li>
<li>RegSvcs.exe</li>
<li>vbc.exe</li>
<li>csc.exe</li>
<li>AppLaunch.exe</li>
<li>cvtres.exe</li>
</ul>
<p>Cardinal RAT will continue to parse an embedded configuration. This configuration, named internally as ‘GreyCardinalConfig’, is a binary blob that contains a mixture of base64-encoded data, DWORDs, and Boolean values. Using a custom written Python script, we parsed the configuration of an example sample:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
$ python decode_parse_config.py GreyCardinalConfig
Mutex: cpS3H2NSA65T67mUqB3a
GUID: 952407f889285547985aa2fcf35c5383
Campaign: 04/04/2016 Public
Number of C2 Servers: 1
C2 Server: secure[.]affiliatetoday[.]xyz
Port: 4425
Communication Key: H7sVBirLvGwVfLSLSeI2
Connection Delay: 3500
Buffer Size: 20480
Max Buffer Size: 40960000
Unknown Integer: 70000
Prevent System Sleeping: 0
Hide File: 0
Die on Sandbox Detection: 0
Keylogging: 1
Install Name: None</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-7">7</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-8">8</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-9">9</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-10">10</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-11">11</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-12">12</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-13">13</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-14">14</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-15">15</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-16">16</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-17">17</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-1"><span class="crayon-sy">$</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">python </span><span class="crayon-i">decode_parse_config</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-e">py </span><span class="crayon-e">GreyCardinalConfig</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-2"><span class="crayon-i">Mutex</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">cpS3H2NSA65T67mUqB3a</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-3"><span class="crayon-i">GUID</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">952407f889285547985aa2fcf35c5383</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-4"><span class="crayon-i">Campaign</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">04</span>/<span class="crayon-cn">04</span>/<span class="crayon-cn">2016</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-m">Public</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-5"><span class="crayon-e">Number </span><span class="crayon-e">of </span><span class="crayon-e">C2 </span><span class="crayon-i">Servers</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-6"><span class="crayon-e">C2 </span><span class="crayon-i">Server</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">secure</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span><span class="crayon-i">affiliatetoday</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span><span class="crayon-e">xyz</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-7"><span class="crayon-i">Port</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">4425</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-8"><span class="crayon-e">Communication </span><span class="crayon-i">Key</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">H7sVBirLvGwVfLSLSeI2</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-9"><span class="crayon-e">Connection </span><span class="crayon-i">Delay</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">3500</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-10"><span class="crayon-e">Buffer </span><span class="crayon-i">Size</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">20480</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-11"><span class="crayon-e">Max </span><span class="crayon-e">Buffer </span><span class="crayon-i">Size</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">40960000</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-12"><span class="crayon-e">Unknown </span><span class="crayon-t">Integer</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">70000</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-13"><span class="crayon-e">Prevent </span><span class="crayon-e">System </span><span class="crayon-i">Sleeping</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-14"><span class="crayon-e">Hide </span><span class="crayon-i">File</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-15"><span class="crayon-e">Die </span><span class="crayon-e">on </span><span class="crayon-e">Sandbox </span><span class="crayon-i">Detection</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-16"><span class="crayon-i">Keylogging</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f7e925715326-17"><span class="crayon-e">Install </span><span class="crayon-i">Name</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">None</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0003 seconds] -->
<p>As we can see, this particular sample is configured with a single command and control (C2) server, however, we have seen other samples with multiple host and port combinations. We can also identify a communication key in it, which is crucial when discussing network communications.</p>
<p>After the configuration is parsed, Cardinal RAT will proceed with making attempts at connecting with the C2. Using an example request and response from a C2 server, we can see how this traffic is configured.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-26862 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config.png" alt="cardinal_network_config" width="2708" height="774" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config.png 2708w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config-900x257.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config-300x86.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config-768x220.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config-1024x293.png 1024w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/cardinal_network_config-370x106.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 2708px) 100vw, 2708px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 12 Parsed network traffic communication</em></p>
<p>Data is transmitted in two pieces—a DWORD specifying the data length, as well as the data itself. The data is encrypted using a series of XOR and addition operations, followed by decompression using the ZLIB library. Represented in Python, this may be implemented as follows:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
def decrypt(md5_key, data):
  key = data[-1]
  remaining = data[0:-1]
  c = 0
  out = ""
  for x in remaining:
    b = md5_key[c%len(md5_key)]
    out += chr(ord(x) ^ ord(b) + ord(key) &amp; 255)
    c+=1
  if len(out) &gt; 15:
    if ord(out[0]) == 1:
      out = zlib.decompress(out[1:], -15)
  return out</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-7">7</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-8">8</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-9">9</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-10">10</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-11">11</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-12">12</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-13">13</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-1"><span class="crayon-e">def </span><span class="crayon-e">decrypt</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">md5_key</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">data</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-2"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">key</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">data</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span>-<span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-3"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">remaining</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">data</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span>-<span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-4"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">c</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-5"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">""</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-6"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-st">for</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">x</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">in</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">remaining</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-7"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">b</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">md5_key</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-i">c</span><span class="crayon-sy">%</span><span class="crayon-e">len</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">md5_key</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-8"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>+=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">chr</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">ord</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">x</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>^<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">ord</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">b</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>+<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">ord</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">key</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>&<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">255</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-9"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">c</span>+=<span class="crayon-cn">1</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-10"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">len</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">15</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-11"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">ord</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>==<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-12"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">zlib</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-e">decompress</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>-<span class="crayon-cn">15</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f87847704937-13"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-st">return</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">out</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0003 seconds] -->
<p>The ‘md5_key’ argument in the function above is the MD5 hash of the previously defined ‘H7sVBirLvGwVfLSLSeI2’ string that was contained within Cardinal RAT’s embedded configuration. Now that we know how to decrypt the data, we can look at the previously shown PCAP data and determine what is being sent. The first message decrypts to the following:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
$ python decrypt_cardinal_pcap.py 
Data Length: 3
00000000: 00 00</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736-3">3</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736-1"><span class="crayon-sy">$</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">python </span><span class="crayon-i">decrypt_cardinal_pcap</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-e">py </span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736-2"><span class="crayon-e">Data </span><span class="crayon-i">Length</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">3</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8a683769736-3"><span class="crayon-cn">00000000</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">00</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">00</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p>Followed by the Cardinal RAT’s response:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-68bcebe3c6f8b258680961" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
$ python decrypt_cardinal_pcap.py 
Data Length: 148
00000000: 00 95 24 07 F8 89 28 55  47 98 5A A2 FC F3 5C 53  ..$...(UG.Z...\S
00000010: 83 4A 00 61 00 73 00 6F  00 6E 00 20 00 42 00 6F  .J.a.s.o.n. .B.o
00000020: 00 72 00 6E 00 00 00 4A  00 41 00 53 00 4F 00 4E  .r.n...J.A.S.O.N
00000030: 00 42 00 4F 00 52 00 4E  00 2D 00 50 00 43 00 00  .B.O.R.N.-.P.C..
00000040: 00 30 00 34 00 2F 00 30  00 34 00 2F 00 32 00 30  .0.4./.0.4./.2.0
00000050: 00 31 00 36 00 20 00 50  00 75 00 62 00 6C 00 69  .1.6. .P.u.b.l.i
00000060: 00 63 00 00 00 57 00 69  00 6E 00 64 00 6F 00 77  .c...W.i.n.d.o.w
00000070: 00 73 00 20 00 37 00 20  00 55 00 6C 00 74 00 69  .s. .7. .U.l.t.i
00000080: 00 6D 00 61 00 74 00 65  00 20 00 00 00 00 00 00  .m.a.t.e. ......
00000090: 00 00 31 00 2E 00 34 00  00 00 30 00 37 00 38 00  ..1...4...0.7.8.
000000A0: 42 00 46 00 42 00 46 00  44 00 30 00 30 00 30 00  B.F.B.F.D.0.0.0.
000000B0: 33 00 30 00 36 00 44 00  32 00 00 00              3.0.6.D.2...</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
